result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles R. Terrio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.
Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles R. Terrio in court with attorney Michael Paul Ericson.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA White makes recommendation.  Atty Ericson will argue jail time.  Plea Questionnaire filed w/NC plea.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE.  DE pleads NC.  Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty. Sentencing arguments.  DE addresses the Court.  Court follows recommendation, grants credit for time served.  Appeal rights given to DE.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: for attorney to appear and act

Defendant Charles R. Terrio in court with attorney Michael Paul Ericson.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant Charles R. Terrio in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Now qualifies for the PD.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles R. Terrio in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will continue to pay into the Clerk of Court for retainer fee.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles R. Terrio in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Contacted counsel, wants to much for retainer.  Defendant is ordered to deposit with the Clerk of Court $200.00 on the 1st and 15th of the month for a retainer fee account.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
for appointment of attorney - denied by the Court.

Defendant Charles R. Terrio in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has filed request for appointment of counsel which is denied by the Court.  Will give the defendant time to seek counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with R.W. except as in family Court matters

Defendant Charles R. Terrio in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
